intro: Pseudogynoxys scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf pseudogynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are actinomorphic, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Asteraceae family. Pseudogynoxys scabra is known for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
